data.name: Sample - IBM QRadar - 1.6.1
data.description: Sample playbooks for "IBM QRadar" connector. If you are planning to use any of the sample playbooks in your environment, ensure that you clone those playbooks and move them to a different collection, since the sample playbook collection gets deleted during connector upgrade and delete.

workflows.name: Get Events Related to an Offense
workflows.description: Retrieves details of events associated with a QRadar offense, from the QRadar server, based on the QRadar offense ID that you have specified.

steps.name: Get Events Related to an Offense

arguments.name: IBM QRadar
arguments.operationTitle: Get Events Related to an Offense

arguments.title: IBM QRadar: Get Events Related to an Offense

routes.name: Start-> Get Events Related to an Offense

workflows.description: Retrieves a list of closing reasons associated with all offenses from the QRadar server.

arguments.title: IBM QRadar: Get Offense Closing Reasons

workflows.name: Get Cases
workflows.description: Retrieves a detailed list of cases from Qradar based on input parameters specified

workflows.name: Get Source IP Addresses
workflows.description: Retrieves IP address details associated with a source address IDs from the QRadar server, based on the source address IDs that you have specified

arguments.title: IBM QRadar: Get Source IP Addresses

workflows.name: Add or Update Table Element
workflows.description: Specify the element to add or update in the reference table on Qradar based on the input parameters specified.

workflows.name: Get Reference Tables
workflows.description: Retrieves a detailed list of reference tables from Qradar

workflows.name: IBM QRadar > Post Create Alert > Fetch Events
workflows.description: Fetch events, source and destination ip address of an offense.

arguments.name: IBM QRadar

params.search_string: SELECT  {{vars.event_query_params}} FROM EVENTS WHERE INOFFENSE({{vars.alertSourceData.offense_data['id']}}) ORDER BY starttime DESC LIMIT {{vars.event_record_limit}} START  '{{vars.offense_start_time}}' STOP '{{vars.current_time}}'

arguments.operationTitle: Make an Ariel Query to QRadar

routes.name: Fetch Events For an Offense -> Update Alert
Configuration -> Fetch Events For an Offense

workflows.name: IBM QRadar > Ingest
workflows.description: This playbook demonstrates Get Offense Operation.

routes.name: Create Alert -> Update Last Offense Pull Time
Update Last Offense Pull Time -> Fetch Related Events of Offense

workflows.name: Get Offense Notes
workflows.description: Retrieves a list of notes associated with a specified offense in QRadar based on the offense ID you have specified.

workflows.name: Close Offense
workflows.description: Closes an offense on the QRadar server based on the offense ID that you have specified.

workflows.name: Create Note
workflows.description: Creates a note for a specified offense in QRadar based on the offense ID you have specified.

workflows.name: > IBM QRadar > Create Alert
workflows.description: This playbook creates the offense as an alert in CyOPs.

workflows.description: Retrieves the record details of a reference table defined by name from Qradar

workflows.name: Create Case
workflows.description: Create a new case on Qradar

workflows.name: Invoke QRadar REST API
workflows.description: Invokes a function to Get or Post an API endpoint on the QRadar server.

arguments.title: IBM QRadar: Invoke QRadar REST API

workflows.name: Update Asset
workflows.description: Updates the attributes of a specific asset on the Qradar server based on the asset ID that you have specified.

workflows.name: Get Offenses from QRadar
workflows.description: Retrieves a list of offenses from the QRadar server based on the filter string that you have specified.

arguments.title: IBM QRadar: Get Offenses from QRadar

workflows.name: Get Offense Types
workflows.description: Retrieves a list containing IDs of all the offense types from the QRadar server.

workflows.name: Manipulate Reference Set Content
workflows.description: Adds or deletes the content that you have specified from a specified reference set on QRadar.

arguments.title: IBM QRadar: Manipulate Reference Set Content

workflows.name: > IBM QRadar > Fetch
workflows.description: This playbook fetches the Offenses.

step_variables._configuration_schema:
[{
		"title": "Search Query",
		"tooltip": "The Query to be run on QRadar to fetch offenses",
		"required": true,
		"editable": true,
		"visible": true,
		"type": "text",
		"name": "filter_string",
		"value": "status=\"OPEN\""
	}, {
		"title": "Pull Offenses in the last X minutes",
		"tooltip": "Limit the search query specified above to filter the offenses created or modified in the last X minutes",
		"required": true,
		"editable": true,
		"visible": true,
		"type": "text",
		"name": "Pull_Sample_Offense_in_Past_X_Minutes",
		"value": 10

	},
	{
		"title": "Timezone of the QRadar server",
		"tooltip": "Required for the time conversion to pull events since the last X minutes for an offense",
		"required": true,
		"editable": true,
		"visible": true,
		"type": "text",
		"name": "qradar_timezone",
		"value": "UTC"

	},
	{
		"title": "Event Record Limit",
		"tooltip": "Pull number of events for an offense",
		"required": true,
		"editable": true,
		"visible": true,
		"type": "integer",
		"name": "event_record_limit",
		"value": 50
	}
]

arguments.last_pull_time: {% if (vars.steps.Get_Macro_Value.data["hydra:member"] | length) > 0 and vars.steps.Get_Macro_Value.data["hydra:member"][0].value | int  > 0 %}{{vars.steps.Get_Macro_Value.data["hydra:member"][0].value}}{% else %}{{ (arrow.utcnow().int_timestamp) - (vars.Pull_Sample_Offense_in_Past_X_Minutes| int)  *60 }}{% endif %}

routes.name: Create QRadar Last Offense Pull Time Macro -> Get Macro Value
Calculate QRadar Epoch Time -> Get Offenses
Get Destination Address Details -> Update Offenses With IP Details
Update Offenses With IP Details -> Set Result
Get Source IP Details -> Get Destination Address Details
Collect IP ids -> Get Source IP Details
Set Time Configuration -> Calculate Diff in min
Get Macro Value -> Set Time Configuration
Create Macro List -> Create QRadar Last Offense Pull Time Macro
Calculate Diff in min -> Calculate QRadar Epoch Time

workflows.description: Retrieves IP address details associated with a destination address IDs from the QRadar server, based on the destination address IDs that you have specified

workflows.name: Get Assets Properties
workflows.description: Retrieves a detailed list of available asset properties from Qradar that can be used with assets update operation.

workflows.name: Make an Ariel Query to QRadar
workflows.description: Executes an Ariel query on the QRadar server. QRadar uses the Ariel Query Language (AQL) to search for offenses or events based on query parameters.

arguments.title: IBM QRadar: Make an Ariel Query to QRadar

arguments.operationTitle: Make an Ariel Query to QRadar

workflows.name: API - Push Offense From QRadar
workflows.description: This playbook demonstrate the QRadar App. You need have QRadar CyberSponse App installed on QRadar.
